programme.title: The Bombing of the Grand Hotel, Brighton
programme.short_synopsis: The night that Irish bombers tried to blow up the British Government in 1984.
programme.medium_synopsis: The bombing of the Grand Hotel, Brighton, was aimed at Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher and her cabinet. The bomb was planted by the Irish militant group, the IRA. Michael Dobbs tells his account.
programme.long_synopsis:
The bombing of the Grand Hotel in Brighton was aimed at UK Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher and her cabinet during the Conservative Party Conference in 1984. 

The bomb was planted by the Irish militant group, the IRA.  

Michael Dobbs was an advisor to the British government at the time and believes the Brighton bombing changed British political life forever.

He tells his account to Witness.
